subject: Re: [junit] RE: [OT] NoClassdefFoundError (was: Exception handling by junit)
msgSnippet: ... In my experience, a missing class file results in a ClassNotFoundException. ClassDefNotFoundError is thrown when you _can_ find the class, but not a
messageBody:
On 9/22/05, Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
> > The problem is that ClassDefNotFoundError is usually (in my
> > experience) thrown as a result of an error in a static
> > initializer.
>
> That's one possibility. Another is a missing class file. Really.

In my experience, a missing class file results in a
ClassNotFoundException. ClassDefNotFoundError is thrown when you _can_
find the class, but not a resulting definition.

It occurs to me that it could also be thrown if the class on disk is
corrupted... the class would be found, but no definition within it
would be loaded.

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
